author: M Soundariya Preetha
text:
On Thursday afternoon, as soon as the Union Government released the list of 20 cities selected for the Smart City Project. And, Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp were abuzz with messages on Coimbatore figuring in the list.

“Smart City has happened. Now, lets start somewhere,” says Ravi Sam, former chairman of the Confederation of Indian Industry – Tamil Nadu.

Coimbatore has an educated population. There should be door-to-door campaign and address the main issues, he says.

According to an analysis of the city submitted by the local body to the Centre for the project, the strengths include a vibrant growing economy, good social infrastructure, and active citizen forums. But, there are gaps in basic service levels, sanitation and water-water infrastructure, growing traffic congestion and accident rates and underdeveloped green areas and open spaces.

There are opportunities to improve finances and leverage potential and transform intrinsic natural habitats into rejuvenated public spaces.

The immediate focus is expected to be on forming the special purpose vehicle.

Coimbatore Corporation plans to have area-based development, have more open spaces and green areas. The entire project would also foster a vibrant economy and have citizen-focused governance.

As the project should be sustainable, it has also come out with a component-wise plan to cover the operation and maintenance costs.

With non-motorised transport system, more solar power systems, sewage treatment plants in all the water bodies, the main civic problems of the city will be addressed, said officials.
title: Coimbatore to become a smarter city
